    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Constructs a new Board object that is 3 rows high, and 3 columns width.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Constructs a new Board object that is 3 rows high, and 3 columns width. theBoard will be filled with Spaces to indicate it is empty.

    • Method Detail

      • getMark

        public char getMark(int row,
                    int col)
        Retrieve the mark at the specified location
        Parameters:
        row - Specify the row number
        col - Specify the column number
        Returns:
        the mark at the specified row and column

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Check if the board is currently full
        Returns:
        true is the "markcount" is equal to 9, else false to indicate the board is yet full

      • xWins

        public boolean xWins()
        Check if Player represented by mark 'X' has won the game.
        Returns:
        true is the checkWinner method returns the value 1 for mark 'X', else false

      • oWins

        public boolean oWins()
        Check if Player represneted by mark 'O' has won the game.
        Returns:
        true is the checkWinner method returns the value 1 for mark 'O', else false

      • display

        public void display()
        Print out the current board layout, including the headers, the cosmetic effects, and the two players' placement of the marks.

      • addMark

        public void addMark(int row,
                    int col,
                    char mark)
        Add a mark at the user specified location.
        Parameters:
        row - Row number that the mark is going to be in.
        col - Column number that the mark is going to be in.
        mark - Represents the current player in-play

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Empties the board. This is done by resetting "theBoard" array with white spaces.
